lead_paragraph: Leaders of the United States, Mexico and Canada will announce a climate partnership, synchronizing their national policies to cut greenhouse gas emissions.

byline.contributor: Ian Austen reported from Ottawa, and Coral Davenport from Washington.
byline.original: By IAN AUSTEN and CORAL DAVENPORT

headline.print_headline: Climate Partnership Is Key Topic at North American Leaders’ Meeting
headline.main: Climate Change High on Agenda as Obama and Trudeau Meet for Summit

snippet: Leaders of the United States, Mexico and Canada will announce a climate partnership, synchronizing their national policies to cut greenhouse gas emissions.
abstract: Leaders of United States, Mexico and Canada are set to announce agreement on North America-wide climate partnership, synchronizing their national policies to cut greenhouse gas emissions; will pledge to generate 50 percent of North America's electricity from zero-carbon sources by 2025, up from current 37 percent.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
